data.quote: Friendship is only a reciprocal conciliation of interests.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life  a community of thought  a rivalry of aim.
data.author: Henry Adams

data.quote: True friends ... face in the same direction  toward common projects  interests  goals.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: That friendship may be at once fond and lasting  there must not only be equal virtue on each part  but virtue of the same kind  not only the same end must be proposed  but the same means must be approved by both.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: It is characteristic of spontaneous friendship to take on  without enquiry and almost at first sight  the unseen doings and unspoken sentiments of our friends  the part known gives us evidence enough that the unknown part cannot be much amiss.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Men only become friends by community of pleasures.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship  we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: The reward of friendship is itself. The man who hopes for anything else does not understand what true friendship is.
data.author: Saint Alfred of Rievaulx

data.quote: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
data.author: Francis Quarles

data.quote: The friendships which last are those wherein each friend respects the other's dignity to the point of not really wanting anything from him.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: I have always differentiated between two types of friends  those who want proofs of friendship  and those who do not. One kind loves me for myself  and the others for themselves.
data.author: Gerard de Nerval

data.quote: Friendship  like credit  is highest where it is not used.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
data.author: James F. Byrnes

data.quote: I have learned that to have a good friend is the purest of all God's gifts  for it is a love that has no exchange of payment.
data.author: Frances Farmer

data.quote: If you press me to say why I loved him  I can say no more than because he was he  and I was I.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: He who looks for advantage out of friendship strips it all of its nobility.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility  never an opportunity.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Friendship with oneself is all-important  because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: In a friend you find a second self.
data.author: Isabelle Norto

data.quote: Of my friends  I am the only one I have left.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: I desire so to conduct the affairs of this administration that if at the end ... I have lost every other friend on earth  I shall at least have one friend left  and that friend shall be down inside of me.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Be a friend to thyself  and others will be so too.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Friendship is neither a formality nor a mode: it is rather a life.
data.author: David Grayson

data.quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
data.author: Mencius

data.quote: Friendship's a noble name  'tis love refined.
data.author: Susannah Centlivre

data.quote: A friend is  as it were  a second self.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Friend: One who knows all about you and loves you just the same.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: A friend is like a poem.
data.author: Persian proverb

data.quote: A friend is a present you give to yourself.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: A friend is someone you can do nothing with  and enjoy it.
data.author: The Optimist

data.quote: Friendship needs no words-it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Two friends-two bodies with one soul inspired.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: In poverty and other misfortunes of life  true friends are a sure refuge.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: A faithful friend is the medicine of life.
data.author: Apocrypha

data.quote: Friends are a second existence.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: A real friend helps us think our best thoughts  do our noblest deeds  be our finest selves.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Friendship is a furrow in the sand.
data.author: Tongan proverb

data.quote: Friendship is love without his wings!
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: True friendship is self-love at second hand.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: The real friend is he or she who can share all our sorrow and double our joys.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Friendship is a word the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
data.author: Augustine Birrell

data.quote: Most men's friendships are too inarticulate.
data.author: William James

data.quote: My philosophy is: anyone or anything that gives you knowledge inspires you.
data.author: Gabrielle Reece

data.quote: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with ten thousand people. The hardest is with one.
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than it is a friend.
data.author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

data.quote: To act the part of a true friend requires more conscientious feeling than to fill with credit and complacency any other station or capacity in social life.
data.author: Sarah Ellis

data.quote: Friendship is an art  and very few persons are born with a natural gift for it.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: Female friendships that work are relationships in which women help each other belong to themselves.
data.author: Louise Bernikow

data.quote: The language of friendship is not words  but meanings.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: I can trust my friends. ... These people force me to examine myself  encourage me to grow.
data.author: Cher

data.quote: We challenge one another to be funnier and smarter. ... It's the way friends make love to one another.
data.author: Annie Gottlieb

data.quote: If I made it  it's half because I was game enough to take a lot of punishment along the way and half because there were a lot of people who cared enough to help me.
data.author: Althea Gibson

data.quote: Iron sharpeneth iron  so a man sharp-eneth the countenance of his friend.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A friend can tell you things you don't want to tell yourself.
data.author: Frances Ward Weller

data.quote: I suppose there is one friend in the life of each of us who seems not a separate person  however dear and beloved  but an expansion  an interpretation  of one's self.
data.author: Edith Wharton

data.quote: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
data.author: George Jean Nathan

data.quote: Good company upon the road is the shortest cut.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The particular human chain we're a part of is central to our individual identity.
data.author: Elizabeth Stone

data.quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence  or denies your right to grow.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: The best preservative to keep the mind in health is the faithful admonition of a friend.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: What is thine is mine  and all mine is thine.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: Do not protect yourself by a fence  but rather by your friends.
data.author: Czech proverb

data.quote: If our friends' idealizations of us need the corrective of our own experience  it may be true also that our own sordid view of our lives needs the corrective of our friends' idealizations.
data.author: Oscar W. Firkins

data.quote: In meeting again after a separation  acquaintances ask after our outward life  friends after our inner life.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: In real friendship the judgment  the genius  the prudence of each party become the common property of both.
data.author: Maria Edgeworth

data.quote: The thicker one gets with some people  the thinner they become.
data.author: Puzant Thomain

data.quote: When our friends are alive  we see the good qualities they lack  dead  we remember only those they possessed.
data.author: J. Petit-Senn

data.quote: The company makes the feast.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When one friend washes another  both become clean.
data.author: Dutch proverb

data.quote: I observed once to Goethe ... that when a friend is with us we do not think the same of him as when he is away. He replied  "Yes! because the absent friend is yourself  and he exists only in your head  whereas the friend who is present has an individuality of his own  and moves according to laws of his own  which cannot always be in accordance with those which you form for yourself."
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: In reality  we are still children. We want to find a playmate for our thoughts and feelings.
data.author: Dr. Wilhelm Stekhel

data.quote: Love me  please  I love you  I can bear to be your friend. So ask of me anything ... I am not a tentative person. Whatever I do  I give up my whole self to it.
data.author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

data.quote: Most of our misfortunes are comments of our friends upon them.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Greater love hath no man than this  that a man lay down his life for his friends.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Animals are such agreeable friends- they ask no questions  they pass no criticisms.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Great friendship is never without anxiety.
data.author: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal

data.quote: One out of four people in this country is mentally imbalanced. Think of your three closest friends and if they seem okay  then you're the one.
data.author: Ann Landers

data.quote: She is one of my best friends. Why  I've known her ever since we were the same age.
data.author: Galen Cooper

data.quote: You never know how many friends you have until you rent a cottage at the beach.
data.author: Kraig Kristofferson

data.quote: There are two kinds of people in the world: those who come into a room and say  "Here I am!" and those who come in and say  "Oh  there you are."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Friends are folks who excuse you when you have made a fool of yourself.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A word of advice  don't give it.
data.author: A. J. Volicos

data.quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: Here's a toast to someone who's truly a best friend - a person who goes around telling good things behind your back.
data.author: Elmer Pasta

data.quote: My friend thought he was not gonna make it. Then he started thinking positive. Now he's positive he's not gonna make it.
data.author: Brother Sammy Shore

data.quote: We cherish our friends not for their ability to amuse us but for ours to amuse them.
data.author: Evelyn Waugh

data.quote: There ain't no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
data.author: John Leonard

data.quote: With friends like you - who needs enemas.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Here's a dime. Call all your friends.
data.author: Tom Meany

data.quote: We are both great men  but I have succeeded better in keeping it a profound secret than he has.
data.author: Bill Nye

data.quote: As the psychiatrist said to the cannibal at the end of a session: "Your problem is easy you're just fed up with people."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Should auld acquaintances be forgot  And never brought to mind? Should auld acquaintance be forgot  And days o'auld lang syne?
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Friendship  peculiar boon of Heaven  The noble mind's delight and pride  To men and angels only given  To all the lower world denied.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: What is thine is mine  and all mine is thine.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives  and in their death they were not divided.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Madam  I have been looking for a person who disliked gravy all my life  let us swear eternal friendship.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship  but when thou art in continue firm and constant.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: True friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: By their fruits ye shall know them.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: The ripest fruit first falls.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
data.author: E. Joseph Cossman

data.quote: She's too young for Medicare and too old for me to care.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Gray hair is God's graffiti.
data.author: Bill Cosby

data.quote: I lived in Miami for a while  in a section with a lot of really old people. The average age in my apartment house was dead.
data.author: Gabe Kaplan

data.quote: Good Americans  when they die  go to Paris.
data.author: T. G. Appleton

data.quote: We had a very successful trip to Russia we got back.
data.author: Bob Hope

data.quote: Enjoy life. Think of all the women who passed up dessert on the Titanic.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Everybody should believe in something  I believe I'll have another drink.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I know lots more old drunks than old doctors.
data.author: Joe E. Lewis

data.quote: I'm a one-drink woman  two at the most  three I'm under the table  four I'm under the host.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My doctor said I look like a million dollars - green and wrinkled.
data.author: Red Skelton

data.quote: Condoms aren't completely safe. A friend of mine was wearing one . . . and got hit by a bus.
data.author: Bob Rubin

data.quote: My doctor gave me six months to live  but when I couldn't pay the bill  he gave me six months more.
data.author: Walter Mattbau

data.quote: I can't believe that out of a hundred thousand sperm  you were the quickest.
data.author: Steven Pearl

data.quote: I hope you live to be as old as your jokes.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My wife is the most wonderful woman in the world  and that's not just my opinion - it's hers.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: she: Before we got married  you told me you were well-off. he: I was  and I didn't know it.
data.author: Jacob Braude

data.quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Why did God make man before he made woman? Because he didn't want any advice on how to do it.
